description: This source file implements the methods of the DownloadManagerHttpClient class, which provides functionality to download files via HTTP using libcurl. It includes constructor, destructor, download method, progress callback, and data writing callback functions.

classes.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient
classes.description: A class responsible for managing HTTP downloads, encapsulating cURL operations, progress tracking, and cancellation support.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Constructor initializing cURL handle and setting default member variables.

methods.name: ~DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Destructor cleaning up cURL handle and releasing resources.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient::Status downloadFile(const std::string & url,const std::string & fileName,uint32_t rateLimit)
methods.description: Performs file download from a specified URL to a local filename with optional rate limiting.

methods.name: size_t progressCb(void * ptr,double dltotal,double dlnow,double ultotal,double ulnow)
methods.description: Callback invoked during download to update progress and check for cancellation.

methods.name: size_t write_data(void * ptr,size_t size,size_t nmemb,FILE * stream)
methods.description: Callback to write downloaded data to a file stream.

ctags.name: progressCb
ctags.pattern: /^size_t DownloadManagerHttpClient::progressCb(void *ptr, double dltotal, double dlnow, double ult/
